history.proof: intros S H collection replacement. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment S : forall S : Prop, S \\/ (S -> False) H : SerTop.collection collection : Ens -> Ens -> Prop replacement : functional collection The term "S" has type "forall S : Prop, S \\/ (S -> False)" while it is expected to have type "Ens -> Ens -> Prop" (cannot unify "Ens" and "Prop").

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
(forall S : Prop, S \/ (S -> False)) -> collection -> replacement

Premises:
collection = forall P : Ens -> Ens -> Prop, (forall x x' y : Ens, EQ x x' -> P x y -> P x' y) -> (forall E : Ens, EXType Ens (P E)) -> forall E : Ens, EXType Ens (fun A : Ens => forall x : Ens, IN x E -> EXType Ens (fun y : Ens => IN y A /\ P x y)) : Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive False : Prop := 
replacement = forall P : Ens -> Ens -> Prop, functional P -> (forall x y y' : Ens, EQ y y' -> P x y -> P x y') -> (forall x x' y : Ens, EQ x x' -> P x y -> P x' y) -> forall X : Ens, EXType Ens (fun Y : Ens => forall y : Ens, (IN y Y -> EXType Ens (fun x : Ens => IN x X /\ P x y)) /\ (EXType Ens (fun x : Ens => IN x X /\ P x y) -> IN y Y)) : Prop
Ens_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
BinNat.N.induction : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A n -> A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
BinNat.N.central_induction : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : BinNums.N, A z -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A n <-> A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
EXType_ind : forall (P : Type) (Q : P -> Prop) (P0 : Prop), (forall x : P, Q x -> P0) -> EXType P Q -> P0
List.Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, List.Forall P l -> P0 l
EQ = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
choice = forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop), (forall a : A, EXType B (fun b : B => P a b)) -> EXType (A -> B) (fun f : A -> B => forall a : A, P a (f a)) : Prop
Field_theory.rdiv_ext : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> (forall p q : R, req p q -> req (rinv p) (rinv q)) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rdiv
List.Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), List.Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, List.In x l -> P x)
Ring_theory.pow_pos_add : forall (R : Type) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)) -> forall (x : R) (i j : BinNums.positive), req (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x (BinPos.Pos.add i j)) (rmul (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x i) (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x j))

Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R

Ring_theory.morph0 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> req (phi cO) rO

intros S H collection replacement.
exact (H S).
